text:
“I would hardly call myself classic, so I’m not looking for classic in my white button-downs either,” says Bee Shapiro, New York Times fashion columnist and founder of Ellis Brooklyn. She explains that she’s “always on the hunt for sustainable brands but ones that also have fashion in their veins,” so naturally, she’s drawn to “nearly everything Reformation does, such as this button-down with a vintage vibe,” she adds. “By all accounts it should feel prim and pretty, but instead with a supreme fit and slightly sheer material, it’s just on the right side of hot.” You have to join the waitlist to snag this blouse, but they’ll email you as soon as it’s available and ready to ship.
